page.title: 11CHANGING TIMES
page.content: When the 1863 railway line from Aviemore to Forres was opened,Aviemore was a very small community.Old Aviemore House,an inn with stables etc was the only large building though a few cottages and crofts existed.The nearest shop and Post Office were situated at Lynwilg.Aviemore became an important{railway junction}in 1898 with the opening of the second line through Carrbridge to Inverness.22 houses were built on the NE of the village to house incoming railway workers.Many of these houses still exist today.With this further rail development 2 hotels and several large guest houses were built to provide accommodation for summer visitors.The larger,luxurious Aviemore Hotel was destroyed by fire in the early 1950s but the Cairngorm Hotel is still a popular choice with locals.
